main event: Two soldiers observed an unidentified aerial phenomenon at Fort Bliss, Texas on March 6, 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed at an elevation of approximately 60Â° and appeared to be moving very slowly,The soldiers described the object as reflecting sunlight and compared its size to that of a star,The sighting lasted between 40 to 60 seconds with the object fading out of sight,The weather was clear with no clouds present during the observation,There were no other aircraft reported in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
witness description: 1st Lt. Philip W. Arant and Cpl. Johnnie L. Adams, both soldiers
